definition: to keep a promise/to honor an agreement
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: Of course, there are also some noteworthy issues existing in the CWC implementation.
sentences.chinese: 当然，履约工作也存在一些值得关注的问题。

sentences.english: Only the Performance Certificate shall be deemed to constitute acceptance of the Works.
sentences.chinese: 只有履约证书才应被视为构成对工程的接受。

sentences.english: The practice has proven that China's measures of the CWC implementation are strong and effective.
sentences.chinese: 实践证明，中方的履约措施是得力和有效的。

sentences.english: “Supplier failure is an inherent problem in all supply chains, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说，“供应商不能履约是所有供应链固有的问题”。

sentences.english: Fifthly, further efforts should be made to promote universality and national implementation measures.
sentences.chinese: 第五，加强公约普遍性和国家履约措施。

sentences.english: In thanking you for your esteemed order of the 5th May, I inform you that it has this day been executed.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您5月5日的定单，本月已经履约，特此奉告。

sentences.english: Visible, future European countries do not take any chances, must be strictly the performance.
sentences.chinese: 可见，今后欧洲国家不可心存侥幸，必须严格履约。

sentences.english: We are entitled to cancel the contract which became overdue owing to the buyer's non-performance.
sentences.chinese: 我们有权取消由于买方不能履约而延误的合同。

sentences.english: For the projects undertaken by our corporation, the contract fulfilling rate and qualified rate are 100%.
sentences.chinese: 在公司所承接的施工项目履约率和合格率达100%。

sentences.english: Letters of credit, performance guarantees and bonds.
sentences.chinese: 信用证，履约保函和保证金。

sentences.english: Signing the contract become the balance of Game- Theory, so the contract is more stable than before.
sentences.chinese: 从而履约成为博弈的均衡，因此契约比较稳定。

definition: to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
to defer payment/to pay back over long term
